title: Death threat for Mahesh Bhatt, his wife Soni Razdan and daughter Alia; caller asks for Rs 50 lakh
text:
India Death threat for Mahesh Bhatt, his wife Soni Razdan and daughter Alia Bhatt; unidentified caller asks for Rs 50 lakh Filmmaker Mahesh Bhatt has received a threat to his life from an unidentified individual, who has demanded a sum of Rs 50 lakh. If the Bhatt fails to pay the amount, the individual has threatened to kill his daughter Alia and wife, Soni Razdan. Saurabh Vaktania | Posted by Ganesh Kumar Radha Udayakumar Bhatt initially thought the call was a prank. 2 The caller threatened to "fire several rounds of bullets" into Alia and Soni Razdan if Bhatt didn't pay. 3 This incident took place late on the night of February 26. 
Filmmaker Mahesh Bhatt has received a threat to his life from an unidentified individual, who has demanded a sum of Rs 50 lakh. 
If Bhatt fails to pay the amount, the individual has threatened to kill his daughter Alia and wife, Soni Razdan. 
The police registered an FIR late on Wednesday night, and recorded a statement from Bhatt's family. 
The case has now been transferred to the Mumbai Police's Anti Extortion Cell (ANC), who will investigate the matter further along with other police departments. 
'I WILL FIRE SEVERAL ROUNDS OF BULLETS INTO ALIA AND SONI,' SAYS CALLER 
Mumbai police sources said Mahesh Bhatt received a phone call from an individual claiming to be a gang leader, who demanded 50 lakhs from the filmmaker. 
Bhatt initially thought it was a prank. However, the caller later sent him texts and WhatsApp messages, and told him that not to take the threats lightly. 
He said if his instructions weren't followed, he would kill Bhatt, Alia and Soni. His exact words were: "If you fail to do so, I will fire several rounds of bullets in your daughter Alia and wife Soni." 
He continued to send a few more messages, after which he stopped. 
Bhatt was asked to deposit the money in a Lucknow-based bank branch. This incident took place late on the night of February 26. 
CASE FILED IN JUHU POLICE STATION 
Since his wife's and daughter's lives were in danger, Mahesh Bhatt immediately decided to inform the cops. 
The Bhatts, who live in the posh Juhu locality of Mumbai, approached the area's police station - where a case has been registered, and transferred to the Anti Extortion Cell for further investigation. Mahesh Bhatt's statement has been recorded. 
A police officer told India Today exclusively, "A case is registered under section 387 (causing a person to fear death or grievous hurt, in order to commit extortion.)" 
He said the case had been taken very seriously, and that security had been beefed up. 
This threat to Bhatt's family has come two years after over 13 people belonging to a certain D gang, who had plotted to eliminate Bhatt and his whole family, were arrested in November 2014.
